'Martin Mill' is a village in east Kent, England. It takes its name from the
nearby village of Martin. Martin Mill railway station is on the Dover to Deal
railway line.

The windmill which gives Martin Mill its name was operating commercially until
about 1923 when Sydney Hogben, the owner and former operator, took it into his
head to saw off the sails by his own hand. This caused outrage in the community
and took the mill out of commission forever. The ruins were finally demolished
in the 1960s.
